reviewText: I love Christmas movies and this set contains all good ones.  I highly recommend.  A wonderful value for the price.
I love Hallmark Channel movies.  These were really good.  I can watch them over and over again whenever I want.

I love romance all the time but especially around Christmas time. This is a great romance collection of DVD's.  If you are romantic then this is for you or for someone you might know who is romantic.  You can have Christmas with you all year long.

My husband had been trying, without success, to find "The Most Wonderful Time of the Year" in stores. I looked on Amazon and found the bundle of Christmas movies that included the one my husband wanted. It was a bonus having six wonderful Christmas movies to watch for the price of one movie.

I do love my Christmas movies.
This one was no exception.  First of all, who couldn't love Henry Winkler! Brooke gave a lovable performance as well!  I thought this was a wonderful switch required romance.  You know.  The story where they find the love they never knew that they always needed:) Ah Christmas;)
I love Christmas movies and so it was fun to watch these.  They were very good. Good to sew by.
Six of my favorite movies in a set. Speedy delivery.  Haven't watched them yet, waiting til the week of Christmas, but I'm sure they will be perfect.

Despite being listed on Amazon as widescreen, the two movies I wanted most (which are broadcast yearly in HD widescreen, (Most Wonderful Time of the Year and Moonlight and Mistletoe) are presented here in the old square TV aspect ratio.  Al the movies here are in low resolution (not even as good as an average DVD) and none of them look as good as they do on TV.  So don't waste your money.
I like anything to do with Christmas, especially if its romantic. Great movies. Not recommended for weak and immature men. Lol
LOVED IT!!!!!!!!

I would LOVE this but the discs do not play through.  Halfway through the first movie it hung up and did not go further no matter what I tried.  Since that was one of the main movies I wanted I am less than happy with the whole pack.  Otherwise it is nice in a can and with a lot of padding but if they do not play not worth what I paid for it.

The movies were great but there is a problem with playing The Most Wonderful Time of the Year on my Blue Ray Player.  Just won't play.  I could watch it on a DVD player, but that was the movie I bought the pack for.  Just love it and had it on my DVR but it got erased.
This was in excellent shape, came on time and price was right. Thank you

great

My husband and I are obsessed with Christmas movies.  We LOVE most of this collection.  It comes in a nice metal tin worthy of a collector.  HOWEVER, these movies are such low quality, my husband kept telling me to send them back. I did not want to hassle with it, and I grew up with antenna-TV so it doesn't bother me as much.  I was a little embarrassed because I got them for him as a gift, but we DVR'd the movies so he is happy now.  Not quite sure what I'll do with these.  NOT RECOMMENDED due to low quality video.

Coming off a five-day Thanksgiving Vacation, I was ambushed by my wife and daughters into watching rotten Hallmark Christmas movies. So, in an effort to give you more time to spend with your families, and waste less time watching them, I will give you the plot of every single movie in just one brief post:

Single woman, usually a mother of a small (and troubled or sick) child, finds herself heading into the Christmas Season without a boyfriend, and usually struggling to make ends meet.  Soon she meets her prince and things look good for the relationship until either (A) a rival of the woman does something,  (B) the disapproving parents of the boyfriend interfere, or (C) a simple misunderstanding breaks up the relationship, and (wouldnt you know it) right before Christmas. The new boyfriend is either (A) tremendously wealthy, (B) poor but cute and wise, or (C) royalty.

Then, a Christmas Miracle occurs to repair the relationship just in time for Christmas, and everyone goes on to live happily ever after. The (town/child in need of operation/struggling business of the woman) is saved!

Finally, if you're a male watching this sissy stuff, turn in your "man card" - you'd have to be a wuss to like this!
